name: Pacific Gas & Electric Company PG&E
description: Pacific Gas & Electric Company PG&E provides natural gas and electricity to most of the northern two-thirds of California, including San Jose. They are committed to delivering safe, reliable, and affordable energy.
emergency_steps:
- If you smell gas, hear it escaping, or see a broken gas line, immediately leave the area and go to a safe distance.  
- Avoid using anything that could be a source of ignition, such as cell phones, flashlights, light switches, matches, or vehicles, until you are away from the area.  
- Once at a safe distance, call 9-1-1 for emergency assistance.  
- After contacting emergency services, call PG&E at 1-800-743-5000 to report the gas leak.  
- Do not attempt to shut off the gas yourself unless you have been trained to do so by PG&E.

Non-Emergency Tips:  
- PG&E offers various summer energy savings tips to help reduce your energy use and save on bills.  
- If you need help with your bill, PG&E provides support and payment solutions to assist customers facing financial difficulties pge.com.
